sub_concepts.name: Stable isotopes
sub_concepts.definition: Isotopes of an element that have the same number of protons but different number of neutrons, and do not undergo radioactive decay.

sub_concepts.name: Radiogenic isotopes
sub_concepts.definition: Isotopes of an element that are produced by the radioactive decay of other isotopes.

sub_concepts.name: Isotope geochemistry
sub_concepts.definition: The study of the distribution and abundance of isotopes in geological materials, used to understand Earth's history and processes.

sub_concepts.name: Isotope fractionation
sub_concepts.definition: The process by which isotopes of an element are separated and distributed unequally in a system, due to differences in mass and energy.

sub_concepts.name: Isotope dating
sub_concepts.definition: The use of the decay rates of radioactive isotopes to determine the age of rocks, minerals, and other geological materials.

sub_concepts.name: Isotope tracers
sub_concepts.definition: The use of isotopes as tracers to study the movement and transformation of elements in geological systems.

sub_concepts.name: Mass spectrometry
sub_concepts.definition: An analytical technique used to measure the mass-to-charge ratio of ions, used to determine the isotopic composition of geological materials.
